Reviews.Title: “Property in Miami suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Divinewine
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family in the Kendall area and picked this property to stay. This is located very conveniently to the highway but the traffic in the area is horrendous. Don't want to live in Miami. The room was larger than a normal room in this type of chain.Room had a lot of perks: wet bar, microwave, sitting area, and business desk area. Nice flat screen TV. The complementary breakfast was outstanding, cheese omelets included. Will stay here again on the next family visit. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, modern rooms and tasty breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sestevens
Reviews.Content: Once we managed to make our way back to the hotel after missing the turn (don't miss the turn, it's an ordeal to get back), I was very impressed by the room I had for 3 days here. The room was very spacious, with a sitting area, wet bar, office space, and two beds that I thought were quite comfortable. One of my fellow travelers said that he found it too soft, but I enjoyed it. Bathroom and shower were about what one would expect. The decor is nice and modern, which for some reason makes it all seem cleaner. Breakfast was great! First time I've ever seen a pancake machine that makes pancakes for you on demand. Plus they had plenty of pastries, sausage, bacon, eggs, the whole nine yards. Even little omelets the 2nd day. The location is central to a lot of things, but the traffic on Kendall Dr is a nightmare, like most of Miami. We missed the turn (turn at the Red Lobster/McDonalds) and ended up having to drive 1.3 miles around the block to get back. Within walking distance to a few nice restaurants and feels like a very safe part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Kendall, FL!”
Reviews.Author: Joni T
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Small, cozy, friendly with all the amenities like internet and self laundry. Room was large and spacious with fridge and large TV. A/C was cold and worked like a dream. Basic room set up yet very clean. Excellent breakfast. Many shops and restaurants along the street and nearby. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: I was dissatisfied with another hotel just a couple of miles away and decided to stay the rest of the week at this hotel. It was terrific! The price was the same as the unsatisfactory hotel and the room was so much nicer. Very clean, updated, comfortable room. I had a little kitchen area with a sink, microwave, and refrigerator. A suitable desk area. The "living room" area was very comfortable and the furniture was clean. I could swivel the television to watch while sitting on the couch or laying in bed. Staff was very polite and professional. Didn't have an opportunity to enjoy the breakfast, but it smelled great! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brand Spankin New”
Reviews.Author: sport_paws
Reviews.Content: Everything is new and clean. No coffee set up in the entrance like in most holiday inn's. Staff doesn't speak English but are good at charades. bathrooms seem iffy. Would likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP QUALITY VALUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lrgardner
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 8 nights in november after reading the trip advisor reviews and glad we did.the hotel is excellent. it is a smallish hotel with about fifty rooms on five floors.the room we stayed in was very large with air conditioning, a large shower,sofa ,micorwave,fridge,iron,coffee machine and large screen tv on the wall.the double size bed was clean and very comfy.staff were very pleasant and helpful with room cleaned plus fresh towels every day.it also has free internet access and free coffee all day long.the pool and pool area was clean and a sunbed allways avaiable.the breakfast included was good with a wide range of food to suit all tastes.the best piece is that it was quiet even being about 800 yards from the main road we never heard a sound and slept well which is more than can be said about other usa hotels we have stayed in.opposite the hotel is a small shopping cente which houses a few restaurants and shops which was nice for an evening meal. The only negative comment is the hotel is on the east of miami which is a few miles from south beach and downtown miami,but the bus stops outside the hotel and will take you to the dade shopping mall/metro station.for $2 a person.once there you can purchase a day,s pass for $5 which will allow you to use the mono-rail and bus service to vist down town miami ,south beach and other shopping malls,superb value.you can also use it to get to miami airport if you wish.the weather was great .make sure you visit the everglades and zoo.if you use taxi,s like us to and from the airport expect to pay about $50 each way so use public transport where you can. so although a bit off the main area the hotel more than makes up for it,s position and we found it safe to walk out at night the half mile or so to the restaurants.the traffic is busy but the lights allow you to cross in safety.if we come back to miami this will be our first choice without exception

Reviews.Title: “Always a Clean & Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: act1013
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel for weekend getaways to Miami. The hotel is always clean and comfortable. The rooms are spacious and include a microwave and mini fridge. The staff is courteous and makes checking in easy. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and shopping is just a few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ttchin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the one bedroom suite, breakfast and location. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was large, well equipped with small fridge, sink and microwave. The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. The layout of the bathroom and changing area is a bit awkward. Not an issue for a single traveller but for more than two people it may be an issue. Breakfast was very good with the largest and best selection I have ever seen at a Holiday Inn Express. We had scrambled eggs or cheese omlettes with biscuits and susages on different mornings. Pancakes available every day. The hotel is behind Red Lobster and McDonald's restaurants. Close to other restaurants and about 5 minutes driving from Dadeland Mall. Service was good. Only issue I had was the exclusive use of plastic utensils in the Hotel. I would have appreciated some normal crockery and utensils.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean suites with a great breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: flabrit
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Miami for a wedding in the Kendall area and decided to stay here. The reception staff were pleasant. Our rooms were spacious with a living/work area and a small kitchenette space (no range, just a microwave, fridge and coffee maker). The bedroom area had a queen bed and sink/vanity space (my fiancee did not like the lighting for putting on makeup. Our only complaint was that the bath faucet leaked and we came back to a wet bathroom floor. The furniture was clean, tasteful and modern. In the morning, we went down for the complimentary breakfast. In most hotel chains, this is somewhat limited with a few stale danishes, coffee and, if you're lucky, some juice. However, this hotel surprised us with pastries, biscuits, sausage patties, scrambled egg (which was excellent), yoghurts, coffees and juices. Overall, this was a very nice hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alejandra_73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this HI Express between Sep. 23 and 29 2011. I chose HI Ex. again since my previous experience at HI Express in Los Angeles had been so great..and I must say I was not disappointed at all!!!.. The hotel is around 20-30 minutes from the International airport. The check-in/check-out were pretty quick, the room just perfect with two comfortable queen beds, a living room and a small kitchenette with mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine + daily supply of coffee. The staff was really friendly and always willing to help (some spoke Spanish).. The Hotel is very well located close to the 88th SW street, and being so close to that avenue, we did not hear any traffic noise during all our stay, so it was really quite inside and we could get a great sleep!.. If you are on a budget but do not want to sacrifice quality, this is the hotel for you. The complimentary breakfast is good enough for a quick start (good coffee, scramble and boiled eggs, bagels, juice, milk, yogurt, etc.) and you can have the USA Today delivered daily into your room, or simply available at the lobby. You can also count on a "coffee station" at the lobby with fresh coffee all day long, even coffee to go! If you do not like driving outside your country, like I do, there is stop bus just a few steps from the hotel. By taking bus Nr. 88 you can get directly to the Dadeland Mall or to the Dadeland North Station to take the metrol rail which will take you to the northern side of Miami (same bus for the trip back). We took this bus daily and we could get to the Village of Merrick Park, Bayside Market Place, and even the Sea Aquarium by simply combining with the metro rail and metromover. Next to the hotel you have a Mc Donald's and if you like seafood, there is a Red Lobster just next to the hotel too. I think there are some other restaurants nearby but we did not tried them since we always eat at the malls!!.. There is also a big shopping center across the street next to the Toys R us store, with a Subway, Burger King, a CVS pharmacy, a Marshall store, Kohl's, among others. Overall, I think the hotel is simply excellent! friendly staff, clean, quiet, well located, good breakfast, good free high speed internet. Overall, the HI Express is simply great! :-)

Reviews.Title: “If you're in the area-best area hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerimsw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are visiting family in the area and I have to say that considering all the other hotels that we have stayed in for the past several days, this has to be the cleanest and the most accomodating. It also is the quietest. We have decided to stay an extra two days which is fine with the hotel and they don't charge us extra because it's the weekend. They offer a great complimentary breakfast, which is fresh and fullfilling every morning. The staff at the front desk are also very nice and accomodating - we had to ask them for a plumbing situation and by the time we got back to the hotel, it was finished. I really didn't expect that kind of service, but was pleasantly surprised. The housekeeping service is also very diligent and when we get back after a long day, the room is very tidy and straightened up. It's great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs204
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn had great rooms with comfy beds. Location is near shopping and restaurants. Free internet, breakfast and parking are a plus and the service was also great. Rooms were also clean and come with a fridge and microwave. I highly recommend this hotel especially if you're on a buget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, extremely convenient, tons of restaurants/shops close by”
Reviews.Author: DaFLA305
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel with my kids. The hotel is very conveniently located right off the turnpike and a major street (Kendall Drive = SW 88 Street). The hotel was very clean (the most important factor in my opinion) and the beds were comfortable. The hotel provided a nice free self-serve breakfast with lots of options, free newspaper, and free internet. The hotel is literally within walking distance to a major shopping center (The Palms at Town and Country Center) and lots of other shops and nice restaurants. This was a great staycation hotel for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time to enjoy alone”
Reviews.Author: Priscila_pms
Reviews.Content: Really if you want to enjoy sometime in myami alone this is a good and cheap hotel to be. I liked for the good price and good service. The appartaments also is good. Big King and you sleep as a child. Make you be read to next day. So if you like to travel alone to vacations it is really a good and safe option. But I need to previne you... good to who likes to rest prorpely, cose no to much near of pubs and bars... It is to have a true rest.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night as a pre-cruise stay. We chose this hotel, amongst others, since the hotels closer to the cruise harbours were occupied. We used our points and so the night was free. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The breakfast is a standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast, though the breakfast room is kind of lobby style and not that handy. The location is Ok if you stay there for 1 night, but wouldn't recommend it for several nights.

Reviews.Title: “Our Florida Trip”
Reviews.Author: misfin2
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the Holiday Inn. Loved the balconies and the privacy of them. Rooms were very comfortable and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing To Much Trouble”
Reviews.Author: MikeLeics
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Unfortunately the refrigerator froze my insulin. However the Deputy Manager was very helpful and the Holiday Inn Insurance paid all medical and replacement insulin without any hassle whatsoever. So, well done Holiday Inn. Oh, and the room was comfortable - nothing exceptional, just the normal Express by Holiday Inn accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good new hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: letsgoracin
Reviews.Content: My sister and i spent 2 nights here in November 2008 to attend the Nascar in nearby Homestead. We drove down from Miami airport and had no trouble finding the hotel on 88th St, set back off the main road between Red Lobster and McDonalds. Our initial attempts to check-in early were unsuccessful, but we understood that it was a busy weekend so headed to the racetrack and were swiftly checked in upon our return. The mail the hotel had kindly agreed to receive and keep for me was also ready and waiting at check-in. The hotel is an all suite hotel and had not long reopened following renovations so the decor and appliances were in tip top condition. The kitchenette included a sink, microwave and small fridge which was handy for storing our tailgating supplies in overnight. The Flat screen TV was cleverly positioned in the centre of the room enabling viewing from both the bedroom and living area. The bathroom, containing the toilet and an over bath shower was small but clean. The bathroom sink was incorporated within the bedroom area itself. The air conditioner also worked a treat, not only to cool the room down but also to warm it up after a cold front blew through. The complimentary HIE breakfast did not disappoint and different hot food was on offer both mornings we were there. Although the dining room was busy with race fans fuelling up for the day ahead it was never full or uncomfortably crowded. There is a range of shops and restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Supermarkets and K-Mart/Target/Wallmart/Old Navy are all a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suite, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights over Thanksgiving. Had a nice suite, living room, bedroom. The color scheme left something to be desired unless you like dirt brown, but otherwise the rooms were clean and the furniture was comfortable. This was recently an Amerisuites (the telephone still has the name on it). Note that the hotel sign on W. 88th St. (Kendall Drive) is very difficult to see--look for the Red Lobster--and the hotel is not that well marked yet. Parking was adequate, the breakfast was the usual adequate HIE fare. As I've said elsewhere, we are usually quite satisfied with HIE--not luxury, but not basic either, and usually at a fair price for the value. This was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Basic Hotel-Good free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bornwithwheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last Nascar Race of the 2008 season. This hotel is very new. Check-in was easy, the staff was pleasant. We had a ground floor room but it was not noisy. The hotel is off the main drag so noise is not a factor. It is very close to the turnpike for easy access to where we needed to go. The room was very clean. There is a mini fridge, small sink, microwave and coffee maker. The shower had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. I didn't take pictures of the room however the hotels website is pretty much what you get. The pool is small but clean and there is an excercise room too. The free breakfast was pretty good. There was sausage biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, muffins, cereal and fruit. The usual variety of juices, coffee, etc. The area around the hotel was decent too. We walked to the little store on the corner and we had supper at the Kendall Ale House across the street. There is also an Italian Restaurant next door that looked good, a Red Lobster and a McDonalds all right there. The Dadeland Mall is just a few miles away. Pretty good hotel if you are attending a sporting event or just need a place to stay on a business trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Kendall East Miami
HotelInfo.Address: 11520 SW 88th St, Miami, FL 33176
